intro: Urostigma excelsum, commonly known as the tall bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, often with a slightly hairy texture. Urostigma excelsum is typically found in dry, disturbed soils and can thrive in open fields or along roadsides.
